taxonomicnotes: Superficially simliar Aphanius from Kızılırmak drainage have usually been identified as this species but seem to represent an undescribed species. They are excluded from the assessment of A. danfordii.
rationale: The species is endemic Sultan Sazlığı marshes in Develi depression, Turkey. Sultan Sazlığı marshes once formed a very important wetland area which has been drained and finally dried out in the early 21st century. This species is now restricted to two small spring fields (each 2–3 km²) about 15 km apart, and a few canals attached to the springs in the area (area of occupancy is less than 10 km², and extent of occurrence is estimated to be less than 40 km²). All the water bodies in the area are fed from one aquifer (therefore one location is estimated as water abstraction is the major threat). The species has strongly declined in the past due to the draining of Sultan Sazlığı marshes (for agriculture) and is expected to continuously decline in the future as this process is continuing. The species is therefore assessed as Critically Endangered.
